seriesJson.title: Some American worthies
seriesJson.description: Profiles of curious figures in the American past, based on diaries, journals and other books of personal record.  The speaker is Robert E. Streeter, a professor of English at the University of Chicago.

node.title: John Ledyard, his trip to Siberia
node.description: A profile of 18th century American explorer and adventurer John Ledyard and his trip to Siberia.

node.title: Elihu Burritt, the learned blacksmith
node.description: A profile of Elihu Burritt, an American diplomat, philanthropist and social activist who was nicknamed "The Learned Blacksmith."

node.title: Parson Weems, biographer
node.description: A profile of Parson Weems, the biographer of George Washington.

subject.name: Weems, M. L. (Mason Locke), 1759-1825. Life of George Washington

node.title: Samuel Sewall, Puritan judge
node.description: A profile of Samuel Sewall, a Puritan judge involved with the Salem witch trials.
